channel.title: Running a client after the server set up
channel.description:
I ended up getting
[code] C:\Documents and Settings\Layne.CLARA\Desktop\Silab Server Stuff!\Silab Client>j ava -Xmx512m -jar SilabClient.jar 0 0 highmem members 0 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\Layne.CLARA\Desktop\Silab Server Stuff!\Silab Client>p ause Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
After running the silabsoft client, any ideas?

item.title: Running a client after the server set up
item.dc:creator: @OMG_GTFO OMG GTFO!
item.description:
@OMG_GTFO wrote:

Yeah i set them correctly,
Still pops up.

Read full topic
item.source: Running a client after the server set up

item.title: Running a client after the server set up
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Did you set your classpath correctly?

Go to -
My Computer > Properties > Advanced Settings > Environmental Variables.

Then just edit your classpath.

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Read full topic
item.source: Running a client after the server set up

It’s not just silab,
it’s all of my client’s.
